title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Introduction

BEVs (Battery Electric Vehicles) can reduce \(CO_2\) and prevent air pollution.
But managing BEV charging can become a problem for the grid.
Smart charging can help, but depends on user acceptance.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
SMC - Supplier Managed Charging

SMC smooths out overnight EV charging demand.
Electricity demand is controlled below capacity threshold.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
SMC - Supplier Managed Charging

SMC smooths out overnight EV charging demand.
Electricity demand is controlled below capacity threshold.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: V2G - Vehicle-to-Grid

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Literature Review

A study by Wong et al. (2023) examined incentives affect the EV owners’ acceptance, but EV ownership is only 19%.
A study by Philip and Whitehead (2024) found range anxiety matters, but EV ownership is only 1.28%.
Another study by Huang et al. (2021) indicates the importance of fast charging, but the sample size is only 157.

None of them have demographics data to study heterogeneity.

We need high EV ownership & large sample size, and consider heterogeneity.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Research Questions

Sensitivity: How do changes in smart charging program features influence BEV owners’ willingness to opt in?
Market Share: Under what conditions will BEV owners be more willing to opt in to smart charging programs?


Conjoint survey to collect BEV owners’ willingness.


Mixed logit model to evaluate utilities for simulations.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Survey Design with formr


Survey Components

Conjoint Questions:

Monetary Incentives
Charging Limitations
Flexibility

Demographic Questions:

BEV Ownership & Usage
Personal & Household Info

1
Enrollment Cash
$50 to $300


2

$2 to $20


3
Monthly Override
0 to 5


4
Min Battery
20% to 40%


5
Guaranteed Battery
60% to 80%

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Survey Fielding
Meta: Facebook, Messenger, Instagram - Voluntary

Fielding from March to July in 2024
803 results after filtering

Dynata: Survey Panel - Payment to real BEV owners only

Fielding from September to November in 2024
553 results after filtering

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Survey Results - Top 10 BEV

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Survey Results - Demographics

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Survey Results - Willingness to Participate

Mixed Logit Models
\[
\begin{align*}
u_j = v_j + \epsilon_j = \beta' x + \epsilon_j
\qquad
P_j = \frac{e^{v_j}}{\sum_{k=1}^{J} e^{v_k}}
\end{align*}
\]



SMC Estimates






V2G Estimates







Without compensation, users will not participate.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Enrollment Sensitivity

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Enrollment Sensitivity






Steeper slope indicates higher sensitivity.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Enrollment Sensitivity Combined - SMC

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Enrollment Sensitivity Combined - V2G

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Enrollment Sensitivity Combined - Summary
















Monetary incentives are important.
Recurring incentives are more important than one-time.
For SMC, range anxiety is vital, since it happens regularly.
For V2G, usability is compromised.
Diminishing returns exist.

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs

text: Market Simulation - V2G

title: Measuring Consumer Willingness to Participate in BEV Smart Charging Programs
text:
Reference List




Huang, Bing, Aart Gerard Meijssen, Jan Anne Annema, and Zofia Lukszo. 2021. “Are Electric Vehicle Drivers Willing to Participate in Vehicle-to-Grid Contracts? A Context-Dependent Stated Choice Experiment.” Energy Policy 156 (September): 112410. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.enpol.2021.112410.


Philip, Thara, and Jake Whitehead. 2024. “Consumer Preferences Towards Electric Vehicle Smart Charging Program Attributes: A Stated Preference Study.” Rochester, NY. https://doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4812923.


Wong, Stephen D., Susan A. Shaheen, Elliot Martin, and Robert Uyeki. 2023. “Do Incentives Make a Difference? Understanding Smart Charging Program Adoption for Electric Vehicles.” Transportation Research Part C: Emerging Technologies 151 (June): 104123. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.trc.2023.104123.

title: surveydown Lightning Talk:An Open-Source, Markdown-BasedSurvey Platform
text: Introducing surveydown

title: surveydown Lightning Talk:An Open-Source, Markdown-BasedSurvey Platform
text:
Components


survey.qmd
A Quarto doc defining the main survey content (pages, text, images, questions, etc).



app.R
An R script defining the survey Shiny app. It sets up the database and server, and launches the survey.

 

Check out surveydown.org for more details!

title: surveydown Lightning Talk:An Open-Source, Markdown-BasedSurvey Platform
text:
Run & Deploy
Video

# Deploy to shinyapps.io
rsconnect::deployApp(appName = "my_survey")

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text: Introducing surveydown

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text:
Components


survey.qmd
A Quarto doc defining the main survey content (pages, text, images, questions, etc).



app.R
An R script defining the survey Shiny app. It sets up the database and server, and launches the survey.

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text:
survey.qmd


---
format: html
echo: false
warning: false
---

```{r}
library(surveydown)
```

::: {#welcome .sd-page}

# Welcome to our survey!

```{r}
sd_question(
  type  = "mc",
  id    = "penguins",
  label = "What's your favorite penguin?",
  option = c(
    "Adélie"    = "adelie",
    "Chinstrap" = "chinstrap",
    "Gentoo"    = "gentoo"
  )
)

sd_next()
```

:::

::: {#end .sd-page}

This is the last page of the survey.

```{r}
sd_close()
```

:::

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text:
app.R


# Load Package
library(surveydown)

# Database Credentials
sd_db_config()

# Connect to Database
db <- sd_db_connect()

# Server Setup
server <- function(input, output, session) {

  # Skip logic
  sd_skip_forward(...)

  # Conditional display
  sd_show_if(...)

  # Server settings
  sd_server(
    db = db,
    ...
  )
}

# Launch Survey
shiny::shinyApp(ui = sd_ui(), server = server)

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text: Local Running

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text:
Online Deployment


Data Storage

Any PostgreSQL database
Recommend Supabase (Free)
Use sd_db_config() to set up

 



Deploy


Recommend shinyapps.io (Free):

rsconnect::deployApp(appName = "my_survey")




Other Platforms:


Posit Connect Cloud
Hugging Face
Heroku







Online Data Storage + Online Survey URL

title: surveydown:An Open-Source, Markdown-Based Platform for Interactive and Reproducible Surveys
text:
Summary of Features



Reactivity and randomization


Dashboard for survey data


Cookies for restoration


URL parameters for redirection


Ability to start from selected page


Custom interactive questions

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
Introduction

BEVs (Battery Electric Vehicles) can reduce \(CO_2\) and prevent air pollution.
But managing BEV charging can become a problem for the grid.
Smart charging can help, but depends on user acceptance.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
SMC - Supplier Managed Charging

SMC smooths out overnight EV charging demand.
Electricity demand is controlled below capacity threshold.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
SMC - Supplier Managed Charging

SMC smooths out overnight EV charging demand.
Electricity demand is controlled below capacity threshold.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text: V2G - Vehicle-to-Grid

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
Literature Review

A study by Wong et al. (2023) examined incentives affect the EV owners’ acceptance, but EV ownership is only 19%.
A study by Philip and Whitehead (2024) found range anxiety matters, but EV ownership is only 1.28%.
Another study by Huang et al. (2021) indicates the importance of fast charging, but the sample size is only 157.

None of them have demographics data to study heterogeneity.

We need high EV ownership & large sample size, and consider heterogeneity.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
Research Questions

Sensitivity: How do changes in smart charging program features influence BEV owners’ willingness to opt in?
Market Share: Under what conditions will BEV owners be more willing to opt in to smart charging programs?



Conjoint survey to collect BEV owners’ willingness.


Multinomial logit model for utility simulations.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEV Smart Charging Programs
text: Scenario Analysis

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
SMC Scenario Analysis







Flexibility is highly valued.
Recurring incentives are more important than one-time.
Payment alone is not enough.

title: Consumer Preferences for BEVSmart Charging Programs
text:
V2G Scenario Analysis







Still, recurring incentives are more important than one-time.
But flexibility is not as important compared with SMC.
Owners are willing to leverage BEV as a source of income.
